adjective.description: Characterized by or suggesting the practice of severe self-discipline and abstention from all forms of indulgence, typically for religious reasons.
examples: an ascetic life of prayer, fasting, and manual labor

noun.description: A person who practices severe self-discipline and abstention.

origin: Mid 17th century: from medieval Latin asceticus or Greek askētikos, from askētēs monk, from askein to exercise.
